body.p: The Board considered whether to accept that differences in the frequency of interim reporting would result in different earnings per share amounts being reported. However, IAS 34 Interim Financial Reporting states ‘the frequency of an entity’s reporting (annual, half‑yearly, or quarterly) should not affect the measurement of its annual results. To achieve that objective, measurements for interim reporting purposes should be made on a year‑to‑date basis.’
